intro: Koeleria macrantha var. flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid wild oat, is a perennial grass native to the western United States and parts of Canada. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its low-growing form and drought tolerance make it a common weed in agricultural and natural areas.
